cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest toward the northeastern Yucatan Peninsula, then forecast to cross the central Gulf of Mexico and curve toward the Louisiana–Texas coastline early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Yucatan Saturday, then north-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to upper Texas early next week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at the port (cumulative probability about 10%) late Monday night through Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early projections suggest a surge of 3–5 ft is possible along the lower Mississippi River outlets and adjacent bays if the system strengthens on approach.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands associated with Marco could dump 4–6 inches with locally higher totals across southeast Louisiana and the lower Mississippi River Valley.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in rain bands, elevated river currents, and temporary channel restrictions may affect port operations.
